newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan realtor shares fall after land plan unveiled.
newsitem.headline: Japan realtor shares fall after land plan unveiled.

text.p: Shares in Japanese real estate companies retreated in Tuesday morning trade after the government announced plans late on Monday to help the stagnant property market.
As of 0129 GMT, Mitsui Fudosan Co Ltd had fallen by 40 yen to 1,240. Mitsubishi Estate Co Ltd lost 50 yen to stand at 1,270. Sumitomo Realty and Development Co Ltd was down 17 yen at 815.
"The plans had mostly been factored in by the market before the formal announcement and there were no pleasant surprises," one broker said.
